lines.text: There ain't a dame on earth I can't forget in six months.

[sarcastically]
Hildegarde, you're as funny as a cry for help.

[In frustration]
Well, I'm a speckled ape!

[Dryly]
This is no time for a confession, Oscar.
I don't see why I always have to miss my breakfast for these accidents!

[Arriving on the scene to hear Oscar's complaint]
I had an uncle who thought the World War would have been an accident.
How long have you worked around here?
About three months, Ma'am... not countin' the week I was in jail.
What were you doing in jail?
Shootin' craps.
No, I mean what did they put you in jail for?
Shootin' craps.
Hildegarde, this may be what the French call a crime of passion.
Oscar, don't you think we ought to try to keep this case clean?

[to Eddie]
I have a great deal of influence with Inspector Piper. We roomed together in college.

[as Hildegarde tries to get into the police car with Oscar]
Well, where do you think you're goin'? What are you always following me for?
I don't know, Oscar. I guess it's because you always bring out the mother in me.

[Going into the old, dark Gregg Mansion]
This place would be great for an embalmers' convention!
You're a good boy, High Pockets, and I think you'll go far.
Yes, Ma'am, how far should I go?

[Seeing Hildegarde going through a pair of empty pants]
Are you sure you were never married?
There's a time and place to be funny.
How can you find out if a man has false teeth?
Get 'im mad enough to bite yuh.
You're a fine fellow, High Pockets.
Yes, Ma'am, I sure am.
And I know I can trust you to keep quiet about all you told me, understand?
Yes, Ma'am, Miss Withers, when I keeps quiet, I keeps quiet aaalll over.

[to himself]
This sure is gonna be a bad mornin'. Sun coming up red. Everybody's acting more like snapping turtles than white folks. Yes sir!
